state: Who's got a virtual machine and is about to play through an exciting round of TextWorld? You do! Here is how to play! First off, if it's not too much trouble, I need you to travel south. Then, pick up the Henderson's limited edition latchkey from the floor of the spare room. After that, attempt to travel north. And then, check that the Henderson's limited edition box inside the vault is unlocked with the Henderson's limited edition latchkey. After that, assure that the Henderson's limited edition box in the vault is opened. After you have opened the Henderson's limited edition box, pick up the type Y key from the Henderson's limited edition box in the vault. Then, check that the type Y door is unlocked with the type Y key. And then, ensure that the type Y door is open. Then, attempt to travel east. And then, doublecheck that the gate is opened. And then, try to go north. And then, make an attempt to venture west. With that done, take a trip north. And then, retrieve the loaf of bread from the board in the washroom. Alright, thanks! -= Vault =- You arrive in a vault. A normal kind of place. You begin to take stock of what's here. You scan the room, seeing a Henderson's limited edition box. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on. There is a closed type Y door leading east. There is an unblocked exit to the south. > -= Vault =-0/1

-= Spare Room =- Well, here we are in the spare room. The room is well lit. What's that over there? It looks like it's a toolbox. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You scan the room for a shelf, and you find a shelf. However, the shelf, like an empty shelf, has nothing on it. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unguarded. There is a Henderson's limited edition latchkey on the floor. > -= Spare Room =-0/2
You pick up the Henderson's limited edition latchkey from the ground. > -= Spare Room =-0/3
admissible_commands: put Henderson's limited edition latchkey on shelf

state: -= Vault =- You arrive in a vault. A normal kind of place. You begin to take stock of what's here. You scan the room, seeing a Henderson's limited edition box. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on. There is a closed type Y door leading east. There is an unblocked exit to the south. > -= Vault =-0/4
admissible_commands: unlock Henderson's limited edition box with Henderson's limited edition latchkey
optimal_action: unlock Henderson's limited edition box with Henderson's limited edition latchkey

state: You unlock the Henderson's limited edition box. > -= Vault =-0/5
admissible_commands: lock Henderson's limited edition box with Henderson's limited edition latchkey

state: You open the Henderson's limited edition box, revealing a type Y key. > -= Vault =-0/6
admissible_commands: insert Henderson's limited edition latchkey into Henderson's limited edition box
take type Y key from Henderson's limited edition box
optimal_action: take type Y key from Henderson's limited edition box

state: You take the type Y key from the Henderson's limited edition box. > -= Vault =-0/7
admissible_commands: insert Henderson's limited edition latchkey into Henderson's limited edition box
insert type Y key into Henderson's limited edition box
unlock type Y door with type Y key
optimal_action: unlock type Y door with type Y key

state: You unlock type Y door. > -= Vault =-0/8
admissible_commands: insert Henderson's limited edition latchkey into Henderson's limited edition box
insert type Y key into Henderson's limited edition box
lock type Y door with type Y key

state: You open type Y door. > -= Vault =-0/9
admissible_commands: insert Henderson's limited edition latchkey into Henderson's limited edition box
insert type Y key into Henderson's limited edition box

state: -= Canteen =- You've just walked into a canteen. There is a closed gate leading north. There is an open type Y door leading west. > -= Canteen =-0/10

-= Restroom =- You are in a restroom. A normal kind of place. There is an open gate leading south. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going north. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unguarded. > -= Restroom =-0/12

-= Cellar =- You are in a cellar. A normal kind of place. You can barely contain your excitement. You see an opened coffer right there by you. What a letdown! The coffer is empty! You see a safe. You can make out a workbench. But there isn't a thing on it. This always happens! There is an unguarded exit to the east. There is an unguarded exit to the north. There is an unblocked exit to the west. > -= Cellar =-0/13
admissible_commands: insert Henderson's limited edition latchkey into coffer
insert type Y key into coffer
put Henderson's limited edition latchkey on workbench
put type Y key on workbench

state: -= Washroom =- You find yourself in a washroom. An usual kind of place. You can make out a board. The board is usual. On the board you make out a loaf of bread. It doesn't get more TextWorld than this! You can see a counter. The counter is standard. However, the counter, like an empty counter, has nothing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it? You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unguarded. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unblocked. > -= Washroom =-0/14
admissible_commands: put Henderson's limited edition latchkey on board
put Henderson's limited edition latchkey on counter
put type Y key on board
put type Y key on counter
take loaf of bread from board
optimal_action: take loaf of bread from board
